author: yorickdowne
content:
Feedback on Geth DB disk space with history expiry: At least on Sepolia, not as impactful as hoped-for. Is this expected?

Full:

```
eth-sepolia_geth-el-data                                           1         589GB
```

With history expiry `--history.chain postmerge`, fresh sync:

```
eth-sepolia_geth-el-data                                           1         571.4GB
```

author: yorickdowne
content: Full geth command line for the fresh sync: `geth --http --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.vhosts=* --http.corsdomain=* --port 30313 --http.port 8545 --ws --ws.addr 0.0.0.0 --ws.port 8546 --ws.origins=* --metrics --pprof --pprof.addr 0.0.0.0 --authrpc.jwtsecret /var/lib/geth/ee-secret/jwtsecret --authrpc.addr 0.0.0.0 --authrpc.port 8551 --authrpc.vhosts=* --maxpeers 50 --datadir /var/lib/geth --sepolia --history.chain postmerge --verbosity 3`

author: kolbyml
content:
All the pre-merge era1 files for sepolia is `0.7975 GB`
All the pre-merge era1 files for mainnet is `458.49 GB`

author: kolbyml
content: So I don't think there is much at all to prune on sepolia compared to mainnet

author: kolbyml
content: Not a perfect metric, but mainnet's pre-merge history is roughly `458.49/0.7975=574.90` times bigger then sepolia's
